result.execSummary:
The defendant Justen Robey Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:09 Defendant Justen Robey Peters in court with attorney Arne Richard Skatrud.  Defendant Justen Robey Peters in custody.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF4 heard at this time. Thorie: guilty to Ct#1 and dismiss Ct#2. jail concurrent to sentencing in 16CF4. Atty Skatrud and Def agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1; Skatrud stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1. Dismisses Ct#2. DOC is recommending 7-9 months. Thorie requests 9 months on each case; concurrent. 143 days credit. Good time allowed.  Skatrud requests the 7 months, time served. Defendant addresses the court. Court: 16CF4 9 months jail; concurrent to 17CF142. 143 days credit. Release date will be: September 23, 2017. Court orders 59 days jail on 17CF142 release date will be: September 23.
from Probation and Parole Agent T Gilby re: Def is not suitable for community supervision.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.
A Skatrud
Defendant's Amended JOC. Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as addressed.

1:05 Defendant Justen Robey Peters in court, in custody.  Probation Agent Tricia Gilby appeared in court. 16CF7 heard at this time. Agent is asking for 30 days conditional jail time on each case.  Victim would like the no contact in place. Victim Witness Coordinator agrees with keeping the no contact in place. Court orders 30 days jail on each case, concurrent. Def has been in custody since Sept 20. Huber is allowed.
from Probation Agent Tricia Gilby re: requesting Mr Peters serve 30 days of conditional jail for blatantly violating his court order.
Probation review hearing on September 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

12:05  This includes 16CF7   Defendant is present in the courtroom with Attorney Liesl Nelson. William Thorie is present for the State of Wiscosnin  defendant is in custody.  Thorie - In 16CF4  Thorie will file an  Amended Information.  In   16CF7  plead to Ct 2 and dismiss Ct 1   Probation 2 years on each Ct in both cases.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to amended Ct 1 of the information in 16CF4.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  16CF7    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge in Ct 2   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 2 in 16CF7  Ct 1 of this case is dismissed. Court Orders - On each case - each Ct -  S/ W Probation 2 years on each case/ each Ct  conc with each other Conditions:    No contact with JW at   223 E Maple St Apt 301 River FAlls, WI   A 3rd person may arrange for the return of the items from the residence for the defendant.  Conditions as set by the probation. Specific look at the drug and alcohol issues.   Court costs plus DNA fees on each case/Count.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing at 02-08-2016 11:45 am.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 02-04-2016 02:00 pm.  *Mailed to Pepin Co. Jail

03:27 16CF7 also heard at this time.   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Defendant enters not guilty plea on all counts in both cases at preliminary hearing.   Nelson addresses bond conditions and requests lower bond amount.  Thorie objects. Court requests confirmation of a place to stay for Defendant before conditions are amended.  Set pre-trial.

03:12  16CF7 also heard at this time. Defendant Justen Robey Peters in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Justen Robey Peters in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie calls Sgt. Anderson.  Sgt. Anderson is sworn in.  Sgt. Anderson identifies the defendant in the court room.  Thorie examines Sgt. Anderson. Thorie offers Exhibit 1, court receives Exhibit 1.  Attorney Nelson x-examines Sgt. Anderson.  Thorie and Nelson give arguments.     The court finds probable cause on both 16CF4 and 16CF7 and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
LN

3:55 Defendant Justen Robey Peters in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Constitutional rights explained to defendan. Thorie: $5000 signature bond with no contact provisions. 72 hour no contact effective until January 15, 2016. Nelson has no objection to the bond. Objects to the no contact provision.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
